Social Media Manager Job at Dreams Placement Hub




        
    

        
        Dreams Placement Hub (DPH) is a dynamic subsidiary company specializing in recruitment, talent placement, and human capital solutions. We partner with organizations to identify, attract, and place top-tier talent across various sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Lagos (Mainland), Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop, implement, and manage social media strategies aligned with business goals.
	Create and publish engaging content (text, image, video, stories, reels) across various platforms (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter/X, LinkedIn, TikTok, etc.).
	Plan and execute social media campaigns, including paid ads and influencer collaborations.
	Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and mentions in a timely and professional manner.
	Track and analyze key performance metrics (KPIs), prepare monthly reports, and make data-driven improvements.
	Stay up-to-date with the latest social media trends, tools, best practices, and emerging platforms.
	Manage and grow online communities and followers.
	Handle social media crises or PR issues when necessary.
	Able to generate Leads and conversions from the target audience for the business.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree/ HND in Marketing, Communications, Media, or related field 
	Proven experience (2+ years) as a Social Media Manager or similar role.
	Strong understanding of social media platforms, algorithms, and analytics tools (e.g., Meta Business Suite, Hootsuite, Buffer, Google Analytics).
	Proficient in graphic design tools like Canva, Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator) is a plus.
	Experience with social media advertising and influencer marketing is an added advantage.
	Basic video editing skills for reels and TikTok.
	Knowledge of SEO and content marketing.
	Crisis management and community moderation experience.


Method of Application
Interested candidates should send their Resume, portfolio of social media work, and a short cover letter to: dglhrexecutive@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

General Manager Job at Agbeyewa Farms




        
    

        
        Agbeyewa Farms is a world-class agribusiness with farm operations in Ekiti State, Nigeria. We have foresight for expansion into Africa whilst we create decent jobs and economic opportunities for local communities and become a force to reckon with in the agribusiness on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager

Job Location: Ikere Road, Ado-Ekiti - Ekiti
Job type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The General Manager (GM) will provide strategic leadership and operational oversight for all farm activities, ensuring optimal productivity, profitability, and sustainability.
	The GM will lead cross-functional teams across crop production, livestock, agronomy, logistics, and processing while driving innovation and continuous improvement across the value chain.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute short and long-term strategic plans for farm operations and expansion.
	Oversee daily operations, including Cassava cultivation, irrigation systems, equipment, and labor.
	Lead and supervise department heads across production, Finance, People, Talent, Procurement, and Logistics.
	Implement sustainable farming techniques and modern agricultural technologies (e.g., precision farming, mechanization).
	Collaborate with R&D teams to improve yields and develop high-value crops.
	Ensure compliance with all regulatory, health, safety, and environmental standards.
	Develop and manage budgets, cost control systems, and P&L accountability.
	Build strategic partnerships with suppliers, off-takers, government agencies, and investors.
	Foster a performance-driven culture and mentor mid-level managers and field staff.
	Report progress to the CEO and board on KPIs, risks, and new business opportunities.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Agriculture, Agronomy, Agribusiness, or related field (Master’s preferred).
	Minimum of 10 years of progressive leadership experience in commercial agriculture, including 5+ years in a general management or operations director role.
	Proven track record in managing large-scale farm operations (ideally >500 hectares).
	Strong business acumen with experience in budgeting, forecasting, and strategic planning.
	Knowledge of modern farming practices, supply chain systems, and ag-tech.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, result-oriented, and culturally diverse environment.
	Familiarity with Nigerian and West African agricultural policies, climates, and challenges.


Benefits


	Competitive Compensation.   
	5-day workweek.   
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).   
	Wellness Programs   
	Employee Training Programs   
	Growth and Development   
	Mentoring and Counseling.
